thread.title: WWII veteran portrayed in Band of Brothers dies at age 95 | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: WWII veteran portrayed in Band of Brothers dies at age 95 | Daily Mail Online

author: Associated Press
title: WWII veteran portrayed in Band of Brothers dies at age 95 | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Second World War paratrooper who landed in France on D-Day and was portrayed in the hit HBO series Band of Brothers dies at age 95 Edward Tipper, a World War II paratrooper who was portrayed in the HBO series Band of Brothers, has died at age 95 He died February 1 in the Denver suburb of Lakewood, his daughter Kerry said Edward Tipper was a member of the famed Easy Company, and parachuted into France as part of the June 6, 1944, Allied D-Day invasion The company's exploits were retold in Band of Brothers, based on research by historian Stephen Ambrose Tipper was interviewed for the series and was portrayed by actor Bart Ruspoli Published: 05:16 GMT, 12 February 2017 | Updated: 07:05 GMT, 13 February 2017 175 shares
